article_title: Poker Run Raises Money For Children's Home Society
article_text:
Tea, SD

Riders with Those Guys ABATE rolled out for a charity poker run Sunday morning.

The 7th annual event fired up around 11 a.m. at Cheap Shots Bar & Grill in Tea, with a free lunch from Marlin's Family Restaurant and the South Dakota Pork Producers Council.

All proceeds from the $10 entry fee go directly to Children's Home Society.

"I'm very proud to be involved with Those Guys, especially when you see what we're doing for the kids over there. It's awesome. Last year we gave $8,000, so of course we'd like to be more like $9,000 to $10,000 this year," Those Guys ABATE President Dave Brende said.

"Oh, it's fantastic. We get to go out and ride our bikes and have fun and then be able to help the kids at the Children's Home Society," participant Scott Hillard said.

The run included a stop for lemonade and cookies at Children's Home Society's Sioux Falls campus.
